channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Patricia Routledge, star of BBC's 'Keeping Up Appearances,' dies at 96
item.description: Patricia Routledge, known for playing Hyacinth Bucket on the 1990s British television show Keeping Up Appearances, has died at age 96.
item.content:encoded: Patricia Routledge, known for playing Hyacinth Bucket on the 1990s British television show Keeping Up Appearances, has died at age 96.
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Fink

item.title: NPR obtains memo about deploying Illinois Guard in Chicago
item.description: In a memo obtained by NPR, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth lays out details on the proposed deployment of Illinois National Guard to Chicago.
item.content:encoded: In a memo obtained by NPR, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth lays out details on the proposed deployment of Illinois National Guard to Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Is Trump's war on drug cartels legal?
item.description: John Yoo helped developed the legal framework for the post-9/11 wars in the George W. Bush Justice Department. He argues Trump trying to invoke war powers too extraordinary to be used against crime.
item.content:encoded: John Yoo helped developed the legal framework for the post-9/11 wars in the George W. Bush Justice Department. He argues Trump trying to invoke war powers too extraordinary to be used against crime.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: France's political crisis deepens as the latest prime minister resigns after a month
item.description: The latest French government lasted just 18 hours as France's third prime minister in a year resigned. The two premiers before him were brought down in no confidence votes. He didn't get that far.
item.content:encoded: The latest French government lasted just 18 hours as France's third prime minister in a year resigned. The two premiers before him were brought down in no confidence votes. He didn't get that far.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: A contribution from Basque immigrants, 'Picon Punch' is having a big year in Nevada
item.description: The Picon Punch, a strong cocktail brought to Nevada by Basque immigrants, is having a big year. It just became the state's official drink, and a Nevada distiller is now making its main ingredient.
item.content:encoded: The Picon Punch, a strong cocktail brought to Nevada by Basque immigrants, is having a big year. It just became the state's official drink, and a Nevada distiller is now making its main ingredient.
item.dc:creator: Fil Corbitt

item.title: Amidst a slow wine market, winemakers say they're struggling this harvest
item.description: A global drop in demand for wine has led to a grape glut, and many U.S. vineyards are letting their grapes rot rather than harvesting them. Growers say it's one of the worst wine years in decades.
item.content:encoded: A global drop in demand for wine has led to a grape glut, and many U.S. vineyards are letting their grapes rot rather than harvesting them. Growers say it's one of the worst wine years in decades.
item.dc:creator: Anna King

item.title: A new memoir charts the decline and resilience of an Ohio town
item.description: In her new memoir, author and journalist Beth Macy returns to her hometown of Urbana, Ill., to learn how it changed from a stable working- and middle-class community to a town struggling with poverty.
item.content:encoded: In her new memoir, author and journalist Beth Macy returns to her hometown of Urbana, Ill., to learn how it changed from a stable working- and middle-class community to a town struggling with poverty.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Bari Weiss is CBS' editor in chief
item.description: Bari Weiss quit The New York Times to launch The Free Press. Now, she's joining CBS News as its top editor.
item.content:encoded: Bari Weiss quit The New York Times to launch The Free Press. Now, she's joining CBS News as its top editor.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Where are Kennedy Center audiences going?
item.description: Most of us have a venue we love — a theater or concert space — where we really feel at home. But what do you do if that place goes through radical changes?
item.content:encoded: Most of us have a venue we love — a theater or concert space — where we really feel at home. But what do you do if that place goes through radical changes?
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: To win this Maryland contest, be on the lookout for big trees
item.description: A hundred years ago, Maryland's first state forester challenged residents to find the state's biggest tree. Now the contest is back. Scott Detrow speaks with Joli McCathran of the Big Tree Program.
item.content:encoded: A hundred years ago, Maryland's first state forester challenged residents to find the state's biggest tree. Now the contest is back. Scott Detrow speaks with Joli McCathran of the Big Tree Program.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
